qTitle: LSA PRE-QUIZ for UPPER PRIMARY STUDENTS (P4, P5, P6)

questions.qInstructions: Choose one option for each question

qData.qText: Information shared on the Internet is always true and can be trusted.
Others can see anything I put online.

questions.qInstructions: Choose one option for each question

qData.qText: Using a computer for too long will affect your eyes.
Spreading rumors about a friend on social media is a form of cyberbullying.

qOptions: Nobody â€“ I should keep them to yourself

qData.qText: Who can you share your passwords with?

qOptions: Ignore it, tell a trusted adult (parent, teacher) straight away
Send the picture if I think I know them
Ask them what they need my picture for

qData.qText: What should you do if a stranger asks you to send a picture of yourself to them?

qOptions: Someone I think I have met before
People I personally know, and even that, I have to be careful

qData.qText: Who should you accept as a friend from online?

qOptions: Show it to my teacher or Guidance and Counselling Officer or a trusted adult
Forward the photo to other students or friends
Laugh at the photo with my friends

qData.qText: An embarrassing photo of a classmate has been sent by someone. What should you do with it?

qOptions: Using the internet every day or all the time
Not using the internet at all
Limiting the amount of time spent online daily

qData.qText: Which of the following is a way to ensure living a balanced life while having access to the internet?

qOptions: Leave them and report them to a trusted adult (parent, teacher, Guidance & Counselling Officer)

qData.qText: What action should you take against online friends who always make you angry?

qMessage: Well done! You have completed the Pre Test Questionnaire
qAcknowledgments:
Thank you very much for taking part!
 Now, you can start using the Life Skills App!
